org.wonderly.jini
Class PersistentJiniService

java.lang.Object
  org.wonderly.jini.PersistentJiniService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
Example1, JiniExplorerImpl, PersistantJiniService, PropertiesUIDemo
public class PersistentJiniService
extends Object
implements Remote

This class provides a base class for creating persistant Jini services. This class provides all the necessary things needed to have a persistent configuration associated with all of the Jini administrative configuration. It uses the JiniAdmin class to perform all of the standard Jini admin tasks. This class does not implement the Adminstrable interface, that is left to subclasses so that remote access is delegated only if you wish it to be.

Author:
Gregg Wonderly.

getAdmin

public Object getAdmin()
                throws RemoteException
Get the JiniAdmin instance that we are using to manage the administration of this instance. If you want remote access to the JiniAdmin stub, you should create a subclass of this which implements an interface (Administrable) that has getAdmin() in it. Then, you can getAdmin() to get the reference.

Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
JiniAdmin

startService

public void startService(String name,
                         String serFile,
                         Entry[] items,
                         String[] groups,
                         String[] lookupLocators,
                         Logger logWriter)
                  throws IOException
Start the service registration process using the passed data.

Parameters:
name - the default initial name for the service.
serFile - the file to store the serialized data for service config into.
items - the Entry objects used to describe the service initially
groups - the groups to look for LUS in
lookupLocators - any unicast locators to use
logWriter - the stream to send exception messages and other progress/error messages to
Throws:
IOException

writeObjState

public void writeObjState(PersistentData state)
                   throws IOException
Writes out the complete serialized state including the state parameter and calling writeAppState(). The default implementation uses an ObjectOutputStream.

Throws:
IOException

readObjState

public PersistentData readObjState()
                            throws IOException,
                                   ClassNotFoundException
Reads in the complete serialized state returning the PersistantData passed to writeObjState(), also calling readAppState(). The default implementation uses an ObjectInputStream.

Throws:
IOException
ClassNotFoundException
